intro: Paracaryum aucheri, commonly known as Persian violet, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and clusters of showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Paracaryum aucheri is also valued for its ability to thrive in dry conditions, making it a resilient addition to arid landscapes.
